captions.text: [Commitment] T.O.P's Passion for Action
Action Mission! Forget the rhythm!
It was really hard at first.
I have spent more time on stage
and I had no experience as an action star.
The way I had to do things were like...
Bam! Bam! Like this....

(Martial Arts Director Mun Shik Jun)
With a dance, the rhythm goes up and down.
But with action moves, the rhythm stays the same.
Don't ride the rhythm like a dance. Go BAM!
Forgetting the rhythm was hard.
I had to try really hard to get it done.
He's good.
Warm up
Attack
Dodge
3:1 Action!
Master : Master
Gun fights!
I thought to myself, "What's going on?"
I think I was in a state of shock.
I cut a blood vessel on a piece of broken glass
and I was so surprised that I didn't feel any pain.
I underwent a surgery to connect the blood vessel so I can't make a fist correctly.
A battle scar for his passion for action.
I remember sweating so much filming the action during the middle of summer
that I collapsed because my legs gave out.
Then the filming in the middle of winter.
I remember it being so hard.
But it's fun to see things processing and developing.
Cut! Okay
There were a lot of happenings during the filming of the movie.
All the staffs contributed greatly
and it's a movie we have great confidence in.
'Commitment'. Look forward to it.

Commitment
In theaters November 6, 2013
